error.actions: You can take a <1>Try again</1> or <3><0>Report</0></3> the issue.

web.title: WEB
web.load-sdk: Load a <script> in the test project;
web.init-sdk: <0>Then, initialize it and check the</0> <1>configuration options</1>:
web.plugins: <0>PageSpy can integrate plugins on demand to extend the capabilities of the SDK, such as:</0> <1>DOM recording</1>, <2>offline caching</2>, <3>and more. If needed, you can check the</3> <4>plugin details</4>;

mp.title: Mini Program
mp.request-host: Add the page-spy server domain to the whitelist of the miniprogram http and websocket requests. Note that the miniprogram requires https and wss protocols, except for the development environment.
mp.install-sdk: First, install dependencies in the project. We provide SDKs for different platforms, you may choose the one you need:
mp.init-sdk: <0>Import the SDK in the entry file and initialize it，check the </0> <1>configuration options</1>：

harmony.title: Harmony
harmony.install-sdk: Install dependencies in the target HAP directory:
harmony.init-sdk: <0>Import and initialize the SDK at the appropriate location, using EntryAbility as an example. Check the</0> <1>configuration options</1>:

rn.title: React Native
rn.install-sdk: First, install dependencies in the project:
rn.init-sdk: <0>Import and initialize the SDK at the appropriate location. Check the</0> <1>configuration options</1>:
rn.storage-plugin: <0>If you use the official recommended storage library @react-native-async-storage/async-storage, we provide an independent plugin for you:</0> <1>Async Storage plugin</1>

inject.start-debug: Start debugging by clicking the <1>Connections</1> menu at the top!

banner.title:
All-In-One
Remote Debugging Tool
banner.desc: Debug remotely and easily with a range of features like chrome devtool.

devtool.eval-plugin-required: If you need to dynamically execute code in mini program, please use @huolala-tech/page-spy-plugin-mp-eval in client SDK.
devtool.mp-warning: When submitting the mini program for review, DO REMEMBER to delete the plugin-mp-eval in the code, otherwise the review will fail.

console.mp-code-error: Code format is incorrect. Friendly reminder: currently the mini program environment only supports ES5 syntax.

error-trace.title: Error detail
error-trace.failed-title: There are some issues with locating the source code
error-trace.failed-advice: Here are some suggestions to fix and improve the situation:
error-trace.fix-suggestion-1: <0>1. Ensure file existence: When locating the source code for each error stack, two files need to be requested - the compressed file and the sourcemap file. The rule for obtaining the sourcemap file is based on the address indicated by</0> <1>//# sourceMappingURL=*</1> <2>in the contents of the compressed file;</2>
error-trace.fix-suggestion-2: 2. Troubleshoot network issues: If there are access restrictions on the server where your source files are located, it may lead to failed requests when trying to access the resources. You can open the devtool to check if the network is working properly.

storage.empty-detail: Select one to preview its value

socket.client-not-in-connection: No client in the current connection. Please check the WebSocket of the client.
socket.client-fail: Client has lost the connection, please contact the relevant tester.
socket.reconnect-fail-desc: Reconnect failed, you have lost the connection. Please refresh the page or select another.

connections.maximum-alert: Just show partial connections. Please further filter through the conditions.

replay.title: Replay Log
replay.invalid-params: No valid URL parameters found in the link.
replay.invalid-blob: <0>Failed to read parameters from the URL; the object may have been cleared</0><1><0></0></1>
replay.online-link-tips: Please enter the link to the online log
replay.delete-desc: Are you sure you want to delete this log?
replay.delete-select-desc: Are you sure you want to delete selected logs?
replay.unsupport-spread: <0>Objects cannot be expanded by default. Set <1><0>serializeData: true</0></1> to enable.</0>

lab.welcome-desc:
With just a few lines of code, empower your system with robust 'feedback capabilities'.
All data stays local, with no network transmission, ensuring complete privacy.
lab.install-desc: Framework agnostic. Choose any method to integrate into your project.
lab.comment-title: Title displayed on floating ball and popup
lab.comment-autoRender: Call $feedback.open() to open the popup if set to false
lab.customize-lDesc: Theme color, logo, and title are customizable. Below are reference cases.
lab.customize-rDesc:
Everything is ready! Click the float ball rendered at the bottom right.
Try entering a comment in the popup and export the logs.
Soon, I'll guide you to <5>review your own replay!
